a new interpretation of the equal protec-
tion clause. On this new interpretation, strict scrutiny would still be applied
to most racial classifications, but strict scrutiny need not be passed when the
state uses a racial classification to serve a benign, remedial purpose.The pur-
pose of a racial classification is benign when it does not stigmatize anyone
and was not adopted out of any discriminatory motive, and it is remedial if
